basis: The user explicitly endorses a structured, lightweight plan and expresses willingness to adapt timing, which indicates intent. However, prior interactions show a pattern of promising plans without consistent execution, especially around BED-related strategies. Given this history, a mid-low action value (2.5) best reflects likely behavior: some engagement, but not guaranteed consistent follow-through.
coaching_notes: Leverage micro-commitments and external accountability to improve follow-through. Consider turning each main plan item into a tiny, non-negotiable action (e.g., 1 concrete trigger log per day, 1 reminder at a fixed time, 1 short reflection). Provide quick, tangible rewards for consistency and build in simple after-action prompts to identify what helped and what to adjust next time. Tailor support around reported triggers (work stress, fatigue, boredom) with specific, concrete coping strategies and environmental nudges.
